[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Indigent Defense Management System (IDMS) defines case tracking, attorney assignment, and reporting requirements to enhance judicial administration in Tarrant County.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: IDMS enables case management, workflows, and real-time judicial communication while ensuring legal compliance.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: IDMS integrates with case filing platforms, financial management systems, and judicial data repositories.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: IDMS offers a web dashboard and portals for court staff, attorneys, and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: IDMS runs on standard judicial IT infrastructure, supporting cloud-based and on-premise environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: IDMS processes case data in formats compatible with judicial and financial regulations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: IDMS ensures encrypted data exchange across judicial and financial entities.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: IDMS optimizes data storage for case records and analytics.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: IDMS guarantees continuous case management operations with failover mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: IDMS is configurable to support diverse judicial workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: IDMS integrates with reporting, compliance, and financial audit services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: IDMS manages case intake, attorney assignments, progress tracking, and financial reconciliation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for court staff, attorneys, financial administrators, and compliance officers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: IDMS requires secure network access, real-time case data, and judicial database integration.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: IDMS assumes adherence to legal protocols, secure API integrations, and availability of financial records.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: CCP: Texas Code of Criminal Procedure.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with case filing systems for data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with financial systems for attorney payments (REQ-FUNC-004).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall track attorney appointments and case progress.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate reports on case timelines and resolutions.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall notify stakeholders of updates (REQ-USAB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide dashboards for tracking case updates (REQ-FUNC-003).
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall allow customized compliance reporting.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process 1,000 case updates within 5 minutes.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 200 concurrent users (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall log operations for audits (REQ-ATTR-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall comply with ACID principles.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall operate on judicial IT platforms.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to CCP and judicial protocols.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale based on user load and maintain logs for compliance verification (REQ-COMP-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Verified through unit, integration, and performance testing.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and troubleshooting guides.
[SEC] 5. References: CCP, judicial guidelines, and Tarrant County protocols.
